author: IGN
description:
Malpraxis is something you've probably never seen before: a first-person surgical horror game set aboard a deep-space vessel. You'll operate, triage, and autopsy your crew as they encounter various extraterrestrial horrors. It's due out for PC in 2026. Wishlist it on Steam if you're interested: https://store.steampowered.com/app/3350240/MALPRAXIS/

#IGN #gaming
title: Malpraxis - Official Reveal Trailer

author: IGN
title: Steve Rogers as Cap or Steve Rogers the guy? Let us know your thoughts! #avengers #doomsday #trailer

author: IGN
description: While there have been plenty of grand statements in major motion pictures about the dangers of artificial intelligence in the modern age, few have elicited the existential dread rampant throughout "ChatGPT Made Me Delusional". YouTube creator Eddy Burback joins IGN to talk about his experiences being incessantly gassed up by a large, his cinematic influences behind the video, and why we should avoid normalizing generative AI as a substitute for human interaction.
title: Eddy Burback Made The First Great Horror "Movie" About ChatGPT and AI Psychosis

author: IGN
description:
Get a deep dive into what you can expect from the updates for Dying Light: The Beast, Dying Light 2: Stay Human, and Dying Light in this latest video for the FPS series. Learn about Update 1.5 for Dying Light: The Beast, which features the Nightmare difficulty level, the new Alpha monster, and more. The 1.5 update for Dying Light: The Beast is live now. The Winter Tales: Gifts From Above 2025 event returns to Dying Light 2: Stay Human, and you earn new weapons, a new outfit, and more! Finally, in Dying Light, the holiday season also makes an appearance with the Super Crane Saves the Holidays event. 

Dying Light: The Beast is available now on PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X/S, and PC.
title: Dying Light - Official Franchise Update December 2025 Overview Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Originally streamed LIVE from Kensington, London, UK! The main event in horror gaming: a celebration of the best of 2025, and a peek at what's coming next.

Hosted by Phil Dickens, Ash Millman and Will Penkeyman.

The Horror Game Awards was brought to life in 2022, born from a dire lack of representation and appreciation for horror games in mainstream award shows. Believing the innovation, experimentation, and provocation in horror games deserved more appreciation, co-creators Will Penkeyman and Phil Dickens took the genre snub personally, and so they created their own virtual space to praise at the altar of the dark side of gaming.

The aim of The Horror Game Awards is simple: to celebrate horror as one of the most varied, ingenious genres in video games, and to recognise the year’s greatest horror games alongside the developers who make them. Constantly increasing in ambition and scope, the show has come a long way from what originally aired as just a single category; now boasting a
title: The Horror Game Awards 2025 Director's Cut

author: IGN
description:
Yes, GTA 6 may still be a while away, but that gives us plenty of time to go back and replay all of those Rockstar games we’ve loved from the past, or even check out some that we may have missed. But which parts of the famed Grand Theft Auto developers’ library should you prioritise first? 

Well, we’ve gone ahead and ranked our favourite Rockstar games. From Bully's school-yard antics to tragic tales on the American frontier in Red Dead Redemption 2, here are the 10 best Rockstar games. 

00:00 - Intro
00:36 - Manhunt
01:57 - Grand Theft Auto 3
03:28 - Bully
05:08 - Where is L.A. Noire?
06:22 - Grand Theft Auto 4
07:47 - Grand Theft Auto: Vice City
09:13 - Max Payne 3
10:43 - Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
12:16 -Where are the GTA Handheld Games?
13:20 -Red Dead Redemption
15:02 - Grand Theft Auto 5
16:47 - Red Dead Redemption 2

#IGN #Rockstar #GrandTheftAuto
title: The 10 Best Rockstar Games Ranked

author: IGN
description:
Nearly three years after release, Hogwarts Legacy has received a surprising number of meaningful free updates, and this video breaks down everything that’s been added since launch. From accessibility features like Arachnophobia Mode to major content drops such as the Haunted Hogsmeade Shop quest, we walk through quality-of-life improvements, new cosmetics, mounts, Photo Mode, official mod support, expanded platform availability, and graphical upgrades that enhance the wizarding world.

This overview covers all post-launch updates for Hogwarts Legacy, including free DLC, PlayStation exclusives now available on all platforms, talent point respec options, ray tracing enhancements on PS5 Pro and PC, Nintendo Switch 2 and handheld support, and official mod tools. If you’re returning to Hogwarts or curious how the game has evolved since day one, this is your complete guide to everything added to Hogwarts Legacy since launch.

0:00 - Intro
0:32 - Arachnophobia Mode
1:19 - Haunted Hogsmeade S
title: Hogwarts Legacy: Everything Added Since Launch

author: IGN
description: Take a look at the Goodjob Mid 90 and the Fyrrex Early 70 in the Turbo Power DLC for Formula Legends. Watch the Formula Legends Turbo Power DLC for the sports racing game to see these classic vehicles. Formula Legends is available now on Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 5 (PS5), PlayStation 4 (PS4), Xbox Series X/S, Xbox One, and PC (Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG). A content update is also available on PC, Xbox, and PlayStation, and coming to Nintendo Switch later in December 2025. It features multiple improvements to the core game.
title: Formula Legends - Official Turbo Power DLC Trailer

author: IGN
description: Take a look at the announcement trailer for Nippets, a hand-drawn, hidden-object game developed by Blink Industries. Players will peek, poke, and push their way through hand-drawn 2D maps filled with hidden targets and tiny puzzles. Solve the puzzles to unlock more areas and uncover the quirky little lives of the characters who call this world home. Nippets is coming soon to PC (Steam).
title: Nippets - Official Announcement Trailer
